title: Queen Maxima of the Netherlands visits the MIND Young Academy in Amersfoort
text:
Queen Maxima continued to demonstrate her passion for the youth today, as she visited the MIND Young Academy in Amersfoort, Netherlands.

Following yesterday's radiant appearance at the ScienceMakers Awards, the monarch, 48, stunned in plaid as she joined discussions on helping young people to deal with psychological problems themselves.

She teamed an oversized neutral print blouse with matching wide-leg trousers, completing the look with brown accessories including an envelope clutch bag.

Queen Maxima of the Netherlands (pictured) visited the MIND Young Academy in Amersfoort, Netherlands on Thursday afternoon

The 48-year-old was welcomed to the organisation by two young friends (pictured) holding a sign, asking her to pose for photographs

Taking a seat in the House for Health, the mother-of-three commanded attention by combining a bold pink lipstick with dark lashes.

Queen Maxima toned down the overtly glamorous look by wearing her hair in a relaxed low ponytail.

The royal was welcomed by two young friends holding a sign reading, 'Dear Queen, we are very excited to take a picture with you here. Do you want to come and stand with us?', on arrival.

She then joined experts to discuss stigma in the workplace and spoke with young people who provide vlogs and guest lessons that contribute towards the openness of addressing psychological concerns.

The MIND organisation works tirelessly to support and better understand psychological health in society, as more than 40 per cent of Dutch people experience psychological problems or know someone who does.

The monarch joined stunned in head-to-toe plaid, accessorized with a brown clutch bag and matching belt

Queen Maxima joined conversations with experts to address the prevention of psychological problems in addition to ideas around providing support to those who need it

Queen Maxima who is an international financier by training, appeared delighted to pose for photographs throughout the day.

The mother-of-three daughters, Catharina-Amalia, 14, Alexia, 12, and Ariane, 10, married into the Dutch royal family in 2002.

She wasn't joined today by her husband Willem-Alexander, 52, who became king after his mother, Beatrix, abdicated in April 2013 after 33 years as reigning monarch.

Queen Maxima has reportedly said that she had no inkling that Willem-Alexander was heir to the throne when they first met in Seville, Spain.

The mother-of-three has shown continually interest in the youth, yesterday she attended a science awards for youngsters in Utrecht
description: Queen Maxima of the Netherlands, 48, wore a checked top with voluminous sleeves teamed with wide-legged trousers for a visit to MIND Young Academy in Amersfoort.
